Letter to Kim Jong Il Adopted in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il Adopted in Bangladesh 
   Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at a joint celebration meeting sponsored by the Left Democratic Front of Bangladesh and the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee on Sept. 8 on the occasion of the 58th birthday of the DPRK.
 The foundation of the DPRK on Sept. 9, 1948 was the brilliant crystal of the victory of the anti-Japanese liberation war under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung, the letter said, pointing out that with the foundation of the DPRK, the imperialist forces were defeated and the Korean people could have genuine independent and sovereign state free from exploitation and oppression.    
 The struggle of the Korean people for national reunification is now positively praised by the progressive people of the world including Bangladesh, the letter stressed, expressing the belief that independent and peaceful reunification of Korea would be achieved at an early date under the outstanding Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Sin Song U
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Sin Song U 
   Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Sunday sent a wreath to the bier of Prof. and Dr. Sin Song U, vice-director of the Hamhung Orthopedic Hospital who is deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, "Kim Il Sung Prize" laureate, Hero of Labor and People's Doctor, expressing deep condolences over his death.

Kim Yong Nam Meets Outgoing Dutch Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Outgoing Dutch Ambassador
   Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and talked with Radinck J. Van Vollenhoven, Dutch ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.
 On hand was Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.

articles.title: Greetings to Yemeni President
articles.content:
Greetings to Yemeni President
   Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Yemeni President Ali Abudullah Saleh on Monday on the occasion of the 44th day of revolution in Yemen.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop.
